reviewsJson.markdown:
Molinberry Melty Caramel:
Mixed 4% tested on B2K V4 with a .2 ohm SS316L Stagger Fused Clapton 40 watts. Steeped for a total of 3 weeks and tested once a week.  Flavor was purchased from DIYVAPORSUPPLY


Molinberrys description:
Warm, melty caramel - sweet, delicate and full of flavor. Perfect for dessert mixes. Proposed dose 7-8%


Off the shake:
On the back the hand it taste like a very sweet creamy caramel, but when vaped it has the sweet caramel taste with a musky note on the tail end. 


After one week steep:
The cream/syrupiness is coming through. Sweet caramel is still there but unfortunately that musky/butyric acid like note was also still there. 


Week 2-3
There was no change in flavor from week one testing. The muskiness did seem to be dialed back alittle or maybe i was just getting accustomed to it. 


My thoughts: 
I can not see mixing this solo any higher then 4% the musky butyric acid note would take over the flavor. The caramel note in it is great. Sweetness & creaminess level are both good. Just have that strange musky off note to contend with. Although it seems to be easily covered up when mixed with other flavors. 


Suggested mixing %:
.5-2% if pushed any higher the muskiness will be harder to cover up in the mix. 


Suggested pairings:
Creams,tobaccos,apples,bananas,bakeries,candies, or with another caramel. 


I would rate this 3.5/5 


Recipe is used this in used it at 1.5% and it worked very well in there. 

https://alltheflavors.com/recipes/73521#cinnamon_banana_nut_ry4_by_enyawreklaw
reviewsJson.author: ebc88
reviewsJson.title: Melty Caramel
